alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 11:56AM PDT until May 08 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Silvies River Near Burns affecting Harney County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Silvies River...including Burns...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Silvies River Near Burns. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of fields will occur in the Burns area. Water will encroach on some private properties along North Broadway Avenue, Foley Road, and Stancliff Road. Water will be close to flowing on to Highway 20 at the Silvies River Bridge. Low spots in the Burns RV Park may be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM PDT Wednesday was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.7 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall late tomorrow morning. It will rise to 12.4 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall late Friday morning. It will rise to 13.5 feet late Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 05/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
